1.rationale:
I’ll first re-evaluate our situation:

• Our snake’s head is now at (6,0) with our body at (7,0).
• The closest apple is at (4,2) (Manhattan distance = |6–4| + |0–2| = 2 + 2 = 4).
• Our valid moves are LEFT (to (5,0)) or UP (to (6,1)). We can’t move RIGHT (would run into our body at (7,0)) and DOWN goes off the board.
• Moving LEFT immediately reduces our x-distance to the target apple. From (5,0), the Manhattan distance to (4,2) becomes |5–4| + |0–2| = 1 + 2 = 3. In contrast, moving UP makes the distance still 3, but then our horizontal gap remains.
• The enemy snake at (7,9) is far from our route, so no immediate threats there.

Given our goal to head toward the apple quickly, I’ll continue with my previous strategy and move LEFT.
